programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: Hollywood Icons Of The '80s - Christopher Reeve (7/26/79)
programme.desc: Superman himself Christopher Reeve describes taking acting classes with Robin Williams.

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: Comic Legends Of The '80s - Dan Aykroyd (11/29/85)
programme.desc: This turbo-charged episode featured the comedy triumvirate of David Letterman, Chevy Chase and Dan Aykroyd.

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: Hollywood Icons Of The '80s - Rosanna Arquette (11/7/86)
programme.desc: It's a fear-themed episode as Rosanna Arquette discusses her phobia of critics.

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: Comic Legends Of The '80s - Rich Hall (5/4/83)
programme.desc: Rich wrote for Letterman, “Not Necessarily the News,” joined SNL. Shows mini spa, for dolls, in his bathroom.

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: Talk Show Greats - Jack Paar (12/17/87)
programme.desc: Jack Paar wanted to buy a Rolls Royce for his mother for just $5. Johnny reads kids' letters to Santa Claus.

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: Comic Legends Of The '80s - David Brenner (9/23/82)
programme.desc: David Brenner says people like stuff when it’s free. Discusses NYC, Italian identity. Claims to not enjoy E.T.

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: Comic Legends Of The '80s - Super Dave Osborne (2/10/89)
programme.desc: Stand-up master Super Dave Osborne sends up President George Bush, VP Dan Quayle and….reggae music!

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: The Very Best of Johnny and Guests - Burt Reynolds, Dom DeLuise, Dr. Joyce Brothers (10/12/84)
programme.desc: Burt Reynolds recounts his painful kidney stone. Dom DeLuise keeps getting misstaken for Pavarotti.

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: The Very Best of Johnny and Guests - Joan Rivers, Harvey Korman (9/17/75)
programme.desc: Johnny re-enacts the Hamilton and Burr duel. Joan Rivers admits to screaming during childbirth.

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: The Very Best of Johnny and Guests - Don Rickles, Robert Blake, Desi Arnaz, Bob Hope (3/4/76)
programme.desc: Johnny sings Rhinestone Cowboy. Robert Blake talks Baretta, Don Rickles does his trademark insults.

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: The Very Best of Johnny and Guests - Mel Brooks, The Smothers Brothers, Bob Uecker (7/29/76)
programme.desc: Mel Brooks remembers working in the Catskills and does the 2,000 Year Old Man with Johnny.

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: The Very Best of Johnny and Guests - Dudley Moore, Bob Uecker (9/23/87)
programme.desc: Dudley Moore got his star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame then sings a song. Bob Uecker's nickname was "Stinko."

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: The Very Best of Johnny and Guests - Suzanne Pleshette, Dom Deluise, Bobby Fischer (11/8/72)
programme.desc: Suzanne Pleshette recites a poem. Chess champion Bobby Fischer does a numbers puzzle in just a few seconds.

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: The Very Best of Johnny and Guests - Muhammad Ali, Robert Blake (2/8/73)
programme.desc: Johnny ribs Burbank during the monologue, Muhammad Ali details his training regimen.

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: The Very Best of Johnny and Guests - Wilt Chamberlain, Michael Landon, Johnny Mathis (9/28/73)
programme.desc: Wilt Chamberlain is leaving the Lakers, Michael Landon talks Bonanza, and Johnny Mathis sings "I'm Going Home."

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: The Very Best of Johnny and Guests - Leo Durocher, Don Rickles, Olga Fikotová (11/14/73)
programme.desc: Leo Durocher talks retirement, Don Rickles accidentally bumps Ed but gives him a kiss to make up for it.

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: The Very Best of Johnny and Guests - Paul Williams, Freddie Prinze, Bob Uecker (10/16/74)
programme.desc: Paul Williams sings "You and Me Against the World" and "I Won't Last A Day Without You."

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: The Very Best of Johnny and Guests - Burt Reynolds, Dom DeLuise, Dr. Joyce Brothers (10/12/84)
programme.desc: Burt Reynolds recounts his painful kidney stone. Dom DeLuise keeps getting misstaken for Pavarotti.

programme.sub-title: The Very Best of Johnny and Guests - Joan Rivers, Harvey Korman (9/17/75)
programme.desc: Johnny re-enacts the Hamilton and Burr duel. Joan Rivers admits to screaming during childbirth.

programme.desc: Johnny sings Rhinestone Cowboy. Robert Blake talks Baretta, Don Rickles does his trademark insults.

programme.desc: Mel Brooks remembers working in the Catskills and does the 2,000 Year Old Man with Johnny.

programme.desc: Dudley Moore got his star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame then sings a song. Bob Uecker's nickname was "Stinko."
